channel.title: Quotes on Jared Monger
channel.description: Recent content in Quotes on Jared Monger

item.title: It's All Good. At Least Until The Robots Learn the Nuclear Launch Codes.
item.description: Slate has an article from Ken Jennings talking about his match this week against IBM's Watson Supercomputer. This was my favorite quote. So my defeat at the hands of a machine has a happy ending, after all. At least until the whole system becomes sentient and figures out the nuclear launch codes. But I figure that's years away. Pretty soon we'll all need some Old Glory Insurance.

item.title: Dickens on Personal Budgeting
item.description: “Annual income twenty pounds, annual expenditure nineteen six, result happiness. Annual income twenty pounds, annual expenditure twenty pound ought and six, result misery.” Charles Dickens, David Copperfield

item.title: Taleb on Corporate Bankruptcy
item.description: But corporations can go bust as often as they like, thus subsidizing us consumers by transferring their wealth into our pockets - the more bankruptcies, the better it is for us. Government is a more serious business and we need to make sure we do not pay the price for its folly. As individuals we should love free markets because operators in them can be as incompetent as they wish.

item.title: Predictions
item.description: It is tough to make predictions, especially about the future. -Yogi Berra

item.title: The War Universe
item.description: This is a war universe. War all the time. That is its nature. There may be other universes based on all sorts of other principles, but ours seems to be based on war and games. -William S. Burroughs, Grand Street, No. 37 (1991)
